intro: Cephalaria svanetica, commonly known as the Svaneti cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
